channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One dead and police hurt in knife attack in France
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron said there was "no doubt it was an Islamist terrorist attack".

item.title: Invisible Losses: Tens of thousands fighting for Russia are dying unnoticed on the frontline in Ukraine
item.description: The Kremlin’s recruitment policy is shielding society from the true impact of war.

item.title: Elon Musk says federal employees must document work in email or be fired
item.description: Federal workers across the U.S. government received an email on Saturday, with Musk giving an apparent ultimatum. The billionaire has used a similar t...

item.title: 2/22: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Pope Francis’ condition remains critical after respiratory crisis, says the Holy See; Webcam follows bald eagle couple’s epic love story

item.title: Week in politics: Trump's policy towards Ukraine, mass firings at federal agencies
item.description: We look at President Trump's embrace of Vladimir Putin as he turns his back on U.S. ally, Ukraine, as well as mass firings at government agencies and ...

item.title: NIH funding freeze stalls applications on $1.5 billion in medical research funds
item.description: The National Institutes of Health had to stop considering new grant applications, delaying funding for research into diseases ranging from heart disea...

item.title: LA mayor dismisses fire chief over response to most destructive wildfire in city history last month
List accomplishments or resign, Musk tells US federal workers
item.description: The weekend email comes as Elon Musk leads an effort to aggressively curtail the government workforce.

item.title: Parents and kids navigate talks of loss and tragedy as they return home after LA area fires
item.description: When 11-year-old Ceiba Phillips returned to his Southern California neighborhood a month after the devastating Eaton fire, he couldn’t believe his eye...

item.title: Archaeologists may have found pharaoh's second tomb
item.description: The potential find comes just days after the announcement of the discovery of King Thutmose II's tomb.

item.title: Pope Francis is in critical condition, the Vatican says
item.description: The 88-year-old Francis has been hospitalized for a week with a complex lung infection.

item.title: The Justice Department | Sunday on 60 Minutes
item.description: This Sunday, Scott Pelley examines the recent firings and resignations at the U.S. Department of Justice.

item.title: DOGE's Musk says federal employees must document their work or resign
item.description: Elon Musk's instructions came after President Trump praised the head of DOGE but would like to see him get more aggressive in reducing the federal gov...

item.title: Who is Trump's pick for chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff, Dan Caine?
item.description: Caine is a career fighter jet pilot who defended Washington, D.C., during the 9/11 attacks and been adored by Trump since they met in Iraq during Trum...

item.title: Trump administration looks to slash HUD workers tackling the housing crisis
Man serving 5 life prison sentences walks free after judge gives second chance
item.description: A man sentenced to life in prison, with what seemed like no chance of getting out, is now free. That's because of a 90-year-old judge who is trying to...

item.title: From Baywatch to toxic waste - LA's iconic beaches unrecognisable after fires
item.description: Under orders from President Trump, the EPA is trying to fast track the clean-up of toxic debris from LA's fires.

item.title: Judge frees New York man after sentencing him to 5 life terms 27 years ago
item.description: Walter "King Tut" Johnson was sentenced to five life terms in 1997 by a judge who later released him from prison after 27 years.
